main event: On 7 February 1956, a sighting of unidentified objects, similar to stars, was reported to have disappeared over the horizon by fading, with a course from north to south and a length of observation of thirty seconds.
interesting points: The radar site reported the sighting, but it was not confirmed by the control tower at the Miami International Airport.
The objects were described as wingless, similar in shape and size to a blimp, and silver in color, traveling from northeast to southeast.
The objects were observed to be very high and shining, following a straight course and eventually fading into the horizon.
The observation was made with binoculars and the weather was clear with some broken clouds at 2000 feet.
The operations officer concluded by stating that there was no radar contact and provided no explanation for the sighting.
